metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1064 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
libvirt version before 4.2.0-rc1 is vulnerable to a resource exhaustion as a result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-5748 that affects QEMU monitor but now also triggered via QEMU guest agent.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvirt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu8.2').
